April.title: HackTrix
April.notes: The art of invention and creation is one that must be honed through practice and application. To test the limits of your creativity and innovation, IEEE SRM SB introduces HackTrix, A hackathon-like-no-other packed with learning opportunities, networking, and getting mentored by some of the most experienced individuals in the realm. Sign up for a 3-day development spree from 2nd April 2021 to 4th April 2021 to showcase your revolutionary talents with 8-unique tracks that transform your field and lead you to the top. In a pool of like-minded individuals, innovate, create something extraordinary and bag yourself amazing prizes. If you think the innovator in you is intrigued, go check us out and register for HackTrix now!

April.title: #GileadHacks4HIV
April.notes: #GileadHacks4HIV is a virtual hackathon that will address HIV in a variety of regions, including South Asia and Southeast Asia; Africa, Central Asia and Eastern Europe; Central America and the Caribbean. Your solution should tackle issues such as barriers to access care and treatment, stigma and lack of communication and awareness for those living with HIV and inadequate screening and testing for HIV. Team up online to develop a transformative solution and compete for a share of the $45k prize pool, including a $25k top prize. Don’t wait -- the hackathon is scheduled for April 5 to May 6. Register here to receive hackathon updates, find teammates, and get started on your entry: http://bit.ly/30XjwDi

April.title: CodeWizardsHQ's FREE Coding Challenge - Deep Space Crystal Chase
April.notes: You are Nym of the Allsnacks Alliance. The sinister Glorm has stolen the powerful Xocron Crystal, which The Grand Poomba needs to protect the galaxy! Compete in Code Challenge 2021 to beat the evil Glorm and protect the galaxy. Join our FREE global kids coding challenge from April 5 - May 7 2021. You will travel from planet to planet to answer 21 levels of coding challenges using Python code. If you succeed, compete in the Boss Level for a chance to WIN a $100 grand prize. Beginner-friendly and free! No coding experience necessary. Fun for kids ages 8-18. Details and registration at codewizardshq.com/challenge

April.title: Xylem Global Student Innovation Challenge 2021
April.notes: Are you a high school or college student who loves sustainability and coding? We’re looking for you to innovate water conservation at #xylemstudentchallenge. Join this 8-week virtual hackathon and compete for $20k in prizes. Are you up for the challenge? http://bit.ly/3aQX8B9

April.title: #GileadHacks4HIV
April.notes: Collaborate and transform the prevention, care, and treatment of HIV during the #GileadHacks4HIV Hackathon

April.title: Hack36
April.notes: 36-hour long geeking extravaganza. Think of an idea, make a team of 2-4 students with no year, branch, course and college restrictions. Dd we tell you it's free? Then what are you waiting for? Register ASAP. Join us for 36 hour fun filled with enriching talks, interactive workshops and fun mini games too. Trust us the journey will keep all hackers on the edge of their seats.

April.title: Code2Create 2021
April.notes: Code2Create is one of the biggest college-level hackathons in the country and promises to be a great learning experience for beginners as well as seasoned developers alike. You’ll end up with a mini-project to show-off on your resume, and with prizes worth 5 lakhs, speaker sessions from industry experts, schwags, and fun in-hack activities, you definitely don’t wanna miss this!

April.title: The AI Sports Challenge 2021
April.notes: An online AI programming competition open to all. Program a bot to compete in an online AI multiplayer game for prizes, job opportunities and bragging rights. Registrations close 31 March.

April.title: HackBMU 4.0
April.notes: HackBMU is a hackathon focused on promoting innovation, diversity and networking among all future hackers. We will be hosting upcoming engineers and developers from all over the World to create mobile, web, and hardware hacks for an intense 36-hour session.

April.title: Consilio
April.notes: Consilio calls for creative problem solving methods in all aspects of life. We aim to connect students and professionals from all fields of study, using the tools and methods of design thinking. It’s for trying new things and learning, as well as working with people who have different skill sets. One can work on the visuals, one comes up with the craziest ideas, one has more in-depth insight in the challenge field... Bring out your unique ability to influence the product or feature direction in ways that other people might easily dismiss or underestimate.‍ If you share our passion for learning in a diverse and creative way - welcome, you’re exactly where you're supposed to be!
